website_summaries.verdict: A good pick if you want to grab a single tool and go. This interchangeable screwdriver comes with 4 heads, and stores them inside the handle.
pros: Magnet in shank holds bits and screws
Handle designed for comfort in driving
Storage for bits inside the handle
cons: May arrive branded "Vaco," which is a Klein-owned company

customer_reviews.title: Handy quick change magnetic screwdriver
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a very similar old US Craftsman screwdriver with this. The top of the old unit finally fell apart. Pros - Carries 4 bits which is all one needs for most household/handyman uses. No fumbling with slots and clunky storage. Buy a full bit set if needed for more extensive or bench needs. Good quality driver on par with the *old* Craftsman brand. Cons - The magnet is rather weak. Several times I have tightened a small screw only to find the bit stuck in the screw and not the handle.
customer_reviews.author: Joe S

customer_reviews.title: Could be better
customer_reviews.text: I've had pretty good luck with Klein / Vaco, which is why I chose this driver over others. First the good- This is a solid tool, with very solid USA made bits. The screw cap on the end for bit storage works great. The bad- the magnetic properties of the magnet are non existent. I used the driver twice, both times the bit fell out. If they would have used a rare earth magnet, this would be a 5 star tool. I was so disappointed that I ended up carefully removing the hex shaft from the handle, and replacing it with a Wiha magnetic holder / extension. It was easier than sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: Junkcollector

customer_reviews.title: Its ok with some electrical tape
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a shop tool so I didn't need to take travel screw driver. It's not a terrible screw driver but the magnetism is kinda weak and the head can fall out at times. Wrapped a bit of black tape around the base and it keeps the head wedged in there. Would I have bought it if I knew this ? No. Would I buy another? Probably not. Does it work with electrical tape holding the head in? Yes. But shouldn't have to do that.
customer_reviews.author: FV

customer_reviews.title: I'm a critical get off my lawn type old man. So.
customer_reviews.text: Can't give it five stars because the magnet is weak. When I try to remove tip from tight screw head the tip stayed in the screw.. I do like the handle. I was driving screws into sheet metal... no hot spots on my hand. I have delicate hands. lol
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Dependable Professional Tool
customer_reviews.text: Regular phillips screwdrivers have tips that wear out. That requires replacing the entire tool. With this type of screwdriver you only replace the bit. I have used this magnetic tip screwdriver w/storage in the handle for over 20 years. They take abuse and are very dependable. I normally carry 5 tips inside the handle. I recommend this tool for anyone who needs quality professional tools. If you need it daily, this is a trustworthy tool.
customer_reviews.author: Txwireman

customer_reviews.title: strong magnetic holding, helpful tool to have
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in a Klein packaging but has a Vaco name on it (which is actually shown on the image). Works great. I recently installed shelves that required me to install a header bar about 11 ft above the ground....so holding the bar while installing a screw while standing up high is not fun. But this screwdriver held the 2.5 inch screws perfectly....I could hold the bar with one hand and the driver held onto the screw enabling me to safely get the work done. In other words, the magnetic holding capacity is more than adequate to hold a long screw horizontally. Sure comes in handy.
customer_reviews.author: sammy

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Tool Strong Magnets.
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding tool, strong magnets. After loosing my favorite screwdriver with a magnetic tip I have looked everywhere for a replacement. Most of what I found was inferior. I wanted a screwdriver with a magnetic tip strong enough to not only hold the screwdriver tip but the screw as well. Couldn't find a decent screwdriver, not even at Sears. Craftsman now makes inferior screwdrivers like everyone else. Well at least I can still count on Klein (the actual screwdriver does not bear the Klein name) to produce a decent tool. Nothing else special about this, except that it will hold a screw on the tip as you use it.
customer_reviews.author: TopDog

customer_reviews.title: As good as you will find.
customer_reviews.text: The good: Handle storage is perfect. The cap threads are just the right pitch and length to securely keep the bits. The storage space is just right so the cap does not crash into the bits and jam while being screwed down. The bad: Magnet is weak. It's strong enough to get the job done, but not nearly as strong as most others. On the plus side... it makes tip changes quicker. Supposedly klein purchased vaco tools... which is a good thing since this driver is branded vaco. Would buy again because good drivers with the bits in the handle are rare these days.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Knight

customer_reviews.title: Great Screwdriver Made In USA
customer_reviews.text: As others have stated , I got a VACO screwdriver as opposed to Klein , but it is stamped on the handle MADE IN THE U.S.A. and it works just fine. The magnet seems plenty strong to me ; I just used it to pick up a somewhat rusty 2&1/2 inch screw with no problem. I am very satisfied.

product_meta.title: Klein Tools 70035 Multi-Bit Screwdriver Set, Magnetic Screwdriver with #1 and #2 Phillips Bits and 3/16 and 9/32-Inch Slotted Bits
product_meta.description: With the Klein Tools 5-Piece Magnetic Multi-Bit Screwdriver, you won't lose your bits. Each screwdriver has a powerful magnet built into its shank to hold interchangeable bits and also screws. When not in use, the extra bits can be stored in the handle for quick access and organization. Multi-bit Screwdriver with flat head and Phillips bits. Comfortable handle accommodates interchangeable bits. Magnet inside the 3-3/4-Inch shank firmly holds bits and screws. For more than 160 years, Klein Tools has manufactured premium-quality, professional-grade hand tools that deliver the performance, durability and precision needed to get the job done right. Our family of engineers, workers and craftsman continue to put six generations of expertise into every tool we create by using only the highest quality materials, superior workmanship, and keeping manufacturing as close to home as we can. Klein isn't just the name of our company, it's also our family name. And since we're an American company that's family-owned and family-run, you know you can count on us to be here tomorrow. Klein Tools doesn't just make great products, we make great products that stand up to the demands of the professionals who use them every day ... Since 1857.
